The paper finds that inter-contact times between mobile devices follow a power law up to a characteristic time (~half a day) and decay exponentially beyond it, with insights from network topology analysis, BGP routing behavior, resource optimization in CDMA and cognitive radio networks, and application-level traffic modeling, suggesting prior power-law-based performance analyses may be overly pessimistic.
